Posts.Content: Jul 10, 2008 08:03PM Karen56 wrote: I also use Toms of Maine...as suggested by MSKCC.  I got it first at a health food store, but also found it (cheaper) at Stop & Shop.  It doesn't work as well as my old Degree did, so I carry a small pack of baby wipes in my purse and an extra deoderant so I can freshen up during the day at work or where ever I might be.  Although I finished rads at the end of February, I am afraid to go back to a regular deoderant.  Am I nuts?  What has everyone else been doing?
Posts.Title: Deodorant without bad chems rrs Shirley39

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2008 09:32PM Karen56 wrote: Good old baking soda !! What doesn't it do !!  Does it last all day? I'm going to try that.  Thanks.

Posts.Content: Sep 21, 2008 10:47PM Karen56 wrote: MSKCC told me it was ok to take a multi vitamin and eat well, but not to have excess amounts of antioxidents until treatment was over as it would counteract with the rads.
